     Scoring & Songwriting          ASCAP Film Scoring Workshop      NYU/BMI Music in Advertising Workshop      Summer Songwriters Workshop      Music and the Moving Image           Music Business Music Business Innovation Lab           Music Technology          Summer Electronic Music Institute      Summer Institute of Music Production Technology      Girls Electronic Music Seminar           Music Education          IMPACT Workshop      IMPACT Conference      Kodály Summer Institute      Kodály Summer Institute in Hungary     Performamatics           Dance Education          Teaching Contemporary Limón      Summer Dance Intensive           Educational Theatre          Looking for Shakespeare      New Plays for Young Audiences           Music Therapy          Nordoff-Robbins Music Therapy           Music Theory          Music Theory Pedagogy Workshop              Application Information        How to Apply     Audition Requirements     Housing & Meal Plans     Finances     International Students     Current NYU Students     Information for Summer Students     Information for Parents        Contact Us                     NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar                        Program Description & Faculty | Costs | Apply & Audition | For More Information    Overview    Intended For: All Levels    See the Broadway Percussion Seminar at a glance:       Program Dates: June 14 - June 18, 2015    Priority Application Deadline: April 13, 2015    Final Application Deadline: May 1, 2015    Required Student Orientation: June 14, 2015    Housing Dates: June 14 - June 20, 2015    Tuition: $850    Please note that performance-based and need-based scholarships are not offered in conjunction with this program    Percussion Studies       Program Description & Faculty    Hosted by the NYU Steinhardt Percussion Studies Program, with special guest percussionists, contractors, and conductors from the world of Broadway. Broadway shows and sessions will be presented on drum set, percussion, mallet percussion, timpani, and Latin percussion, by the percussionists who developed the books! For high school, college and professional percussionists, the NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar/Summit is a five-day intensive study of the skills, experience, and know-how into the world of Broadway percussion. Panel discussions will be held with leading percussionists, conductors and contractors who are actively pursuing musical careers on Broadway. In addition, students will attend two Broadway shows, offering the opportunity for each participant to experience a live broadway pit, during an actual broadway show! Dinner will be served after the matinee performance, with the show's percussionists in attendance. Past Broadway Seminar presenters have included: John Clancy and Jon Epcar (Spiderman), Charlie Descarfino (Porgy and Bess), Javier Diaz (Guys and Dolls and Tarzan), Wilson Torres (In the Heights), Dan Haskins and David Ratajczak (Mary Poppins), Pablo Rieppi (West Side Story), Erik Charlston (How to Succeed in Business), James Saporito (NYC Ballet and Tony Awards), Valerie Naranjo and Tommy Igoe (The Lion King), Kory Grossman (Broadway's Super Sub), Ben Herman (Film Recording), and many more.       For a complete list of current NYU Percussion faculty, please click here .    Itinerary & Seminars    Throughout the week, you will have the opportunity to meet and work with several percussionists and contractors who are actively pursuing careers on Broadway. A typical session will cover a variety of topics, including: an overview of the show and book, setup issues, use of technology and video monitors, artist background, subbing on Broadway, pay-scale for Broadway musicians, and many others. Artists will perform excerpts from their book, and hands-on participants will be sent a portion of a show to prepare and perform for the percussionists in a masterclass setting. Participants are typically sent 4 - 6 pieces from one show to prepare. A detailed itinerary of last year's NYUBPS is copied below for reference:        2013 NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar Itinerary*        Sunday :       9:00am : Residence hall check in begins    7:00pm : Welcome Session with Jonathan Haas and Sean Statser        Monday :       10:00am - 1:00pm : Charlie Descarfino (Far From Heaven)    1:00pm – 1:45pm : Lunch Break    1:45pm - 4:45pm : Ben Herman (Film recording session in Dolan Studios) / Javier Diaz (Hands-on session)    4:45pm – 7:00pm : Dinner Break    7:00pm - 10:00pm : Ray Marchica (Mamma Mia)        Tuesday :       10:00am - 1:00pm : Michael Sgouros (Hollow – Player’s Theatre, 115 Macdougal Street)    1:00pm – 2:00pm : Lunch Break    2:00pm – 5:00pm : James Saporito (The Tony Awards)    5:00pm – 7:00pm : Dinner Break    7:00pm - 10:00pm : Kory Grossman (Pirates of Penzance)        Wednesday :       10:30am - 11:30am : NYU Admissions Session    11:30am – 12:15pm : Lunch Break    12:15pm : Leave for Broadway Shows and Pits    2:00pm – 5:00pm : Matinee Performance    5:00pm – 7:00pm : Dinner at Musician’s Union - Local 802    7:00pm – 10:00pm : Evening Performance        Thursday :       11:00am - 2:00pm : John Clancy and Jon Epcar (Spiderman – Room 779)    2:00pm – 3:00pm : Lunch Break    3:00pm - 6:00pm : Roundtable Discussion with John Miller (Broadway Contractor) and artists from throughout the week    6:00pm – 7:00pm : Dinner in Percussion Penthouse       *Please note : The above schedule is a sample and not the confirmed itenerary for the 2014 NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar.       Costs    Below are all costs associated with the Broadway Percussion Seminar:       2015 Tuition: $850    Optional Programming Fee: $40    Application Fee: $50; nonrefundable and paid at the end of the 2015 Summer Application    Housing & Meal Plan (optional): $381 shared room with 10 meals and 30 Dining Dollars per week - see the Housing & Meal Plan page for more information       Please note that there are additional fees for all International Students . For information about financial aid and scholarships, see the Finances page.    Apply & Audition                Acceptance is on a rolling admissions basis and limited to 25 participants. We encourage you to apply early to guarantee your spot.       The final application deadline is May 1 , 2015. A complete application includes:          Complete a 2015 Summer Application    For hands-on participants only: submit all Required Materials (see Broadway Percussion Seminar)             There is NO AUDITION required to participate in the NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar.    If you are planning on attending the Seminar as a hands-on participant , then you are required to submit a placement recording. Hands-on participants will be sent a portion of a Broadway show to prepare for one of the Seminar sessions with the percussionists who developed the books. Show assignments will be made based on your placement recording, experience level, previously performed shows and repertoire, and your given interest in a specific area of Broadway percussion (drum set, Latin percussion, or general percussion).    Submit a recording (either audio or video), that demonstrates your playing in any, or all, of the areas mentioned above. This can include: orchestral excerpts, solo performances, ensemble performances, a compilation of drum set styles, or a compilation of hand drum styles.    Acceptance to the NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar is on a rolling admissions basis. As soon as your application is completed, you will receive your acceptance notification. Once the seminar is filled to capacity, it will be closed for further applications.             For More Information                Program Administration          MPAP Summer Programs 35 West 4th Sttreet, Suite 1077 New York, NY 10012 (p) 212 998 5438 (e) mpap.summer@nyu.edu          Academic Content           Jonathan Haas Percussion Studies Director 35 West 4th Street, Suite 1077 New York, NY 10012 (p) 212 992 9466 (e) jonathan.haas@nyu.edu                    Sean Statser Percussion Faculty 35 West 4th Street, Suite 1077 New York, NY 10012 (p) 212 992 9466 (e) sjs512@nyu.edu                                                                      Department of Music and Performing Arts Professions - 35 W. 4th Street, Suite 1077 -  New York, NY 10012 -  212 998 5424    This site, and all its contents, are Copyright ©    by New York University. Music Business Innovation Lab           Music Technology          Summer Electronic Music Institute      Summer Institute of Music Production Technology      Girls Electronic Music Seminar           Music Education          IMPACT Workshop      IMPACT Conference      Kodály Summer Institute      Kodály Summer Institute in Hungary     Performamatics           Dance Education          Teaching Contemporary Limón      Summer Dance Intensive           Educational Theatre          Looking for Shakespeare      New Plays for Young Audiences           Music Therapy          Nordoff-Robbins Music Therapy           Music Theory          Music Theory Pedagogy Workshop              Application Information        How to Apply     Audition Requirements     Housing & Meal Plans     Finances     International Students     Current NYU Students     Information for Summer Students     Information for Parents        Contact Us                     SummerStrings@NYU: Audition Preparation Workshop                        Program Description | Courses and Faculty | Costs | Apply and Audition | For More Information    Overview    Intended For: High School, Undergraduates and Graduate Students    See the Audition Preparation Workshop at a glance:       Program Dates: June 29 - July 17, 2015    Priority Application Deadline: March 15, 2015    Final Application Deadline: May 1, 2015    Required Student Orientation: June 28, 2015    Housing Dates: June 28 - July 18, 2015    Tuition: $1,800    String Studies        Program Description    NYU SummerStrings Workshops:          College Audition Workshop for high school sophomores, juniors and seniors    Graduate School/Competition Workshop for college/graduate students          The NYU SummerStrings Audition Workshops are open to today’s most talented and promising young musicians, offering intensive training for many types of string auditions. There are two concurrent workshops held over three weeks: one for high school students preparing for college auditions and the other for college and graduate students preparing for competitions and/or graduate school auditions. The intensity of the schedule and exacting performance standards make SummerStrings most appropriate for serious, dedicated musicians ages 15-25.       These audition workshops will give you the skills you need to forge ahead with confidence! Under the guidance of NYU string faculty members, many of whom have won major competitions and orchestral auditions, you will spend your days putting together the elements needed for a successful audition. Faculty will assist you in preparing solo Bach, concerti, showpieces and etudes. You will learn sports psychology techniques to help deal with performance anxiety such as centering, mental practice and the perfect formula for audition preparation.       SummerStrings is pleased to offer Alexander Technique sessions to correct posture and teach bodily self-awareness. Participants who struggle with persistent bad habits have the opportunity to learn a ground-breaking method of overcoming them in as little as an hour. A select few participants will also have the opportunity to make a fully edited recording in NYU’s state-of-the-art James L. Dolan Studio .       Upon completion of the course, you will have a clearer understanding of the audition process that will enable you to achieve your goals!    Courses and Faculty    Both programs include:          Two private lessons per week    One hour of daily chamber music rehearsal or coaching    One hour classes held each afternoon on a series of topics ranging from building confidence through audition strategies to developing one’s musical voice through improvisation and freedom of expression    Five hours of daily practice time    Performance opportunities at bi-weekly student performances, master classes and chamber music recitals    Evening and weekend activities that in the past have included NY Philharmonic concerts, sightseeing in New York City and visits to museums          NYU Artist faculty include Cyrus Beroukhim , Stephanie Chase , Gregory Fulkerson , Kikuei Ikeda , Anton Miller , Naoko Tanaka , violin; Stephanie Baer , Shmuel Katz , Karen Ritscher , viola; Marion Feldman , Eileen Moon , Edward Arron , cello; Joseph Bongiorno , bass; Edward Malave , Alexander Technique and Justin Hines, improvisation.    Costs    Below are all costs associated with SummerStrings@NYU:       Tuition: $1,800    Optional Programming Fee: $120    Application Fee: $50; nonrefundable and paid at the end of the 2015 Summer Application    Housing & Meal Plan (optional): $1,143 shared room with 10 meals and 30 Dining Dollars – see the Housing & Meal Plan page for more information       Please note that there are additional fees for all International Students . For information about financial aid and scholarships, see the Finances page.    Apply and Audition    The College Audition Workshop is open to high school sophomores and juniors. The Graduate School/Competition Audition Workshop is open to current college students. Both programs have limited enrollment so register early to ensure your space!    If you would like to be considered for the workshop you must complete the following:       Complete a 2015 Summer Application    Submit all Audition Requirements and supplemental materials       Please note: late applications will be considered as space permits.
